Quote: The science, the art, the jurisprudence, the chief political and social theories, of the modern world have grown out of Greece and Romeâ€”not by favour of, but in the teeth of, the fundamental teachings of early Christianity, to which science, art, and any serious occupation with the things of this world were alike despicable.
Author: Thomas Henry Huxley,  Agnosticism and Christianity and Other Essays
